intro: Terebinthina aquatica, commonly known as the water terebinth, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cucurbitaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions and is characterized by its climbing habit and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces yellow flowers that are typically borne in clusters, followed by green, edible fruits that turn orange when mature. Terebinthina aquatica is often found in wetland environments and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies and traditional medicine.
